references.title: Clashing Souls
references.desc:
Clashing Souls' TCG text prevents the player's monster from being destroyed by the battle, sending all cards they control to the GY instead.
In the Official Card Game, this is not the case. Here, the monster is determined to be destroyed by the battle as usual, and all cards the monster's controller controls are sent to the GY as a result of this.

references.title: Q&A #20651
references.desc:
This Q&A illustrates the difference between Clashing Souls' TCG and OCG texts.
In the OCG version, Metaltron XII is determined to be destroyed by the battle, causing its Continuous effect to stop applying. As a result, Clashing Souls succeeds in sending it to the GY.
In the TCG version, its Continuous effect is still applying, as it was not determined to be destroyed by the battle. Thus, Clashing Souls would fail to send it to the GY.

references.title: Q&A #9996
references.desc: This Q&A illustrates that Clashing Souls can only succeed in sending Metaltron XII to the GY if its Continuous effect has stopped applying.

name: Clashing Souls

references.title: Card FAQ – All-Out Attacks
references.desc:
All-Out-Attacks should force all monsters to attack this turn, not just monsters that can successfully be changed to Attack Position.
The current text implies that monsters that are already in Attack Position are not forced to attack.

name: Fusion Tag
oldText: Target 1 monster you control; reveal 1 Fusion Monster in your Extra Deck, and if you do, the targeted monster's name can be treated as the revealed Fusion Monster's, if used for a Fusion Summon this turn.
newText: Target 1 monster you control; reveal 1 Fusion Monster in your Extra Deck, and if you do, the targeted monster's name can be treated as the revealed Fusion Monster's, if used as Fusion Material this turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Fusion Tag
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Fusion Tag allows the monster's name to be treated as the revealed monster's when used as Fusion Material, even if not used for a Fusion Summon.

references.title: Elemental HERO Marine Neos
references.desc: Summoning Elemental HERO Marine Neos using the listed procedure is an example of using Fusion Material without performing a Fusion Summon.

name: Time Machine
oldText: When a monster is destroyed by battle and sent to the GY: Special Summon that monster to the same field it was on, in the same battle position it was in when destroyed.
newText: When exactly 1 monster is destroyed by battle and sent to the GY: Special Summon that monster to the same field it was on, in the same battle position it was in when destroyed.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Time Machine
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Time Machine can only be activated if exactly one monster is destroyed by battle.
It cannot be activated if both monsters are destroyed by the battle.

references.title: Card FAQ – Puzzle Reborn
references.desc: Puzzle Reborn is an example of another card that uses the revised textual construct.

name: Metaphys Horus
oldText:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
If this card is Synchro Summoned: You can activate the appropriate effect(s), depending on the non-Tuner monster(s) used as Synchro Material;
●Normal Monster: This face-up card is unaffected by other card effects this turn.
●Effect Monster: You can target 1 other face-up card on the field; negate that target's effects.
●Pendulum Monster: Your opponent chooses 1 monster they control and gives control of it to you, but it cannot attack this turn.
newText:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
If this card is Synchro Summoned: You can activate the appropriate effect(s), depending on the non-Tuner monster(s) used as Synchro Material;
●Normal Monster: This face-up card is unaffected by other card effects this turn.
●Effect Monster: You can target 1 other face-up card on the field; negate that target's effects.

author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #14236
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the "●Pendulum Monster" effect of Metaphys Horus is documented to affect the opponent's monster.

references.title: Herald of the Abyss
references.desc:
Cards that use "your opponent does X to their monsters" are typically cards that do not affect the chosen monsters.
Herald of the Abyss is an example of such a card.

name: Aussa the Earth Charmer

name: Vylon Prism
oldText: If this card is sent from the Monster Card Zone to the Graveyard: You can pay 500 Life Points, then target 1 face-up monster you control; equip this card to that target. If the equipped monster attacks or is attacked: It gains 1000 ATK during the Damage Step only.

name: Desperado Barrel Dragon
oldText: If a face-up DARK Machine monster(s) you control is destroyed by battle or card effect: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. Once per turn, during the Battle Phase (Quick Effect): You can toss a coin 3 times; destroy face-up monsters on the field, up to the number of heads, then if the result was 3 heads, draw 1 card. newText: If a face-up DARK Machine monster(s) you control is destroyed by battle or card effect: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. newText:

name: Ayers Rock Sunrise
oldText: Target 1 Beast monster in your GY; Special Summon that target, and if you do, all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls lose 200 ATK for each Beast, Plant, and Winged Beast monster currently in your GY, until the end of this turn. You can only activate 1 "Ayers Rock Sunrise" per turn.
newText: Target 1 Beast monster in your GY; Special Summon that target, and if you do, all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls (if any) lose 200 ATK for each Beast, Plant, and Winged Beast monster currently in your GY (if any), until the end of this turn. references.title: Card FAQ – Ayers Rock Sunrise
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Ayers Rock Sunrise can be activated even if the opponent controls no monsters, or if there are no other Beast/Plant/Winged-Beast monsters in the player's GY.

references.title: Pulse Mines

oldText:

Cannot be Synchro Summoned. Must be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by sending 2 Level 5 or higher monsters you control with the same Level to the GY (1 Tuner and 1 non-Tuner). Once per turn, when a Spell/Trap Card(s) is Set on your field (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon 1 "Power Tool" Synchro Monster or 1 Level 7 or 8 Dragon Synchro Monster from your Extra Deck. While you control another Synchro Monster, monsters cannot target this card for attacks, also your opponent cannot target it with card effects.
newText:
(This card's original Level is always treated as 12.)

name: S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru
oldText: Each of your opponent's monsters in the same column as one of your "S-Force" monsters can only target that monster for attacks. (Quick Effect): You can banish 1 "S-Force" card from your hand; return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "S-Force" monster from your Deck in Defense Position, except "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru". You can only use this effect of "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru" once per turn.
newText: Each of your opponent's monsters in the same column as one of your "S-Force" monsters can only target monsters in that column for attacks. (Quick Effect): You can banish 1 "S-Force" card from your hand; return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "S-Force" monster from your Deck in Defense Position, except "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru". You can only use this effect of "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effect of S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru still allows the opponent's monster to attack a non-"S-Force" monster, as long as it is in the same column.
An example would be a Knightmare Phoenix in the Extra Monster Zone, with S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru immediately below it.

name: Underworld Goddess of the Closed World
oldText:
4+ Effect Monsters
You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card. If this card is Link Summoned: You can negate the effects of all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls. This Link Summoned card is unaffected by your opponent's activated effects, unless they target this card. Once per turn, when your opponent activates a card or effect that Special Summons a monster(s) from the GY (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation.
newText: 4+ Effect Monsters / You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card. If this card is Link Summoned: You can negate the effects of all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls. This Link Summoned card is unaffected by your opponent's activated effects, unless they target this card. Once per turn, when your opponent activates a card or effect that includes Special Summoning a monster(s) from the GY (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Saros Eresh Kurnugias
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Underworld Goddess of the Closed World's Quick Effect can be activated in response to any effect that includes Special Summoning from the GY.
Its TCG text omits the crucial word "includes" for what we assume to be text box constraints. We opt to use "effect that includes Special Summoning" over "effect that includes an effect to Special Summon" for the same reasons.

references.title: PSY-Framegear Gamma
references.desc: PSY-Framegear Gamma's effect is an example of an effect that "includes an effect to Special Summon from the GY", while not being an effect that "would Special Summon from the GY".

references.title: Primathmech Laplacian
references.desc: Primathmech Laplacian demonstrates the use of "/" instead of a line break after the material line.

references.title: Primathmech Laplacian (physical print)
references.desc: A physical print of "Primathmech Laplacian" showing the use of "/" in the text box.

name: Blackwing - Gust the Backblast
oldText: If you control no cards, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). If your opponent's monster attacks a "Blackwing" monster you control: The attacking monster loses 300 ATK during the Damage Step only.
newText: If you control no cards, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). If your opponent's monster attacks a "Blackwing" monster you control, the attacking monster loses 300 ATK during the Damage Step only.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Blackwing - Gust the Backblast
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Gust the Backblast's effect that causes the opponent's monster to lose ATK is a continuous effect.

name: Blackbird Close
oldText: When an opponent's monster activates its effect: You can send 1 face-up "Blackwing" monster you control to the GY; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it, then, you can Special Summon 1 "Black-Winged Dragon" from your Extra Deck. If you control a "Blackwing" Synchro Monster or "Black-Winged Dragon", you can activate this card from your hand.
newText: When an monster your opponent controls activates its effect: You can send 1 face-up "Blackwing" monster you control to the GY; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it, then, you can Special Summon 1 "Black-Winged Dragon" from your Extra Deck. If you control a "Blackwing" Synchro Monster or "Black-Winged Dragon", you can activate this card from your hand.
author: gallantron

references.title: Blackbird Close
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Blackbird Close can only be activated if a monster on the opponent's field activates its effect.

references.title: Nibiru, the Primal Being
references.desc: For example, in the Official Card Game, Blackbird Close cannot be activated in response to the effect of Nibiru the Primal Being.

name: Light of Intervention
oldText: While this card is on the field, Monster Cards cannot be Set or flipped face-down. If a Monster Card would be Set, it must be Normal Summoned in face-up Defense Position.
newText: Monster Cards cannot be changed to face-down Defense Position. If a monster would be Normal Set or Special Summoned face-down, it must be Summoned in face-up Defense Position instead.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #15901
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Light of Intervention's effect causes effects that Special Summon in face-down Defense Position to Summon the monster face-up, instead.

name: Buster Gundil the Cubic Behemoth
oldText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned (from your hand) by sending 3 "Cubic" monsters you control to the Graveyard, and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. If Summoned this way, this card gains 3000 ATK. This card can make a second and third attack during each Battle Phase. If this card in your possession is sent to your Graveyard by your opponent's card (by battle or card effect): You can target up to 3 "Cubic" monsters in your Graveyard; Special Summon them, then you can add 1 "Cubic" card from your Deck or Graveyard to your hand.
newText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned (from your hand) by sending 3 "Cubic" monsters you control to the GY, and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. If Summoned this way, this card gains 3000 ATK. This card can make a second and third attack during each Battle Phase. If this card in your possession is sent to your GY by your opponent: You can target up to 3 "Cubic" monsters in your GY; Special Summon them, then you can add 1 "Cubic" card from your Deck or GY to your hand.
author: Gil

references.title: Buster Gundil the Cubic Behemoth
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Buster Gundil the Cubic Behemoth uses "sent to the GY by your opponent", with no additional qualifiers.

references.title: Q&A #12280
references.desc:
If Buster Gundil the Cubic Behemoth is sent to your GY by your opponent using the effect of your Summon Over, it is sent to the GY by your opponent, using your card.
In the Official Card Game, the effect of Buster Gundil the Cubic Behemoth can then be activated.

references.title: Underworld Goddess of the Closed World
references.desc: The opponent Link Summoning their Underworld Goddess of the Closed World is another example where the TCG's addition of "card" may cause confusion.

references.title: Gozen Match
references.desc: An opponent's Gozen Match is an example of a card where the TCG's addition of "card" may cause confusion.

name: Noble Knight Custennin
oldText:
If you control a "Noble Arms" Equip Spell, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). You can only Special Summon "Noble Knight Custennin" once per turn this way. A "Noble Knight" monster that was Synchro, Xyz or Link Summoned using this card on the field as material gains this effect.
●If this card is Special Summoned: You can Normal Summon 1 "Noble Knight" monster during your Main Phase this turn, in addition to your Normal Summon/Set (you can only gain this effect once per turn), also, you cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck for the rest of this turn, except "Noble Knight" monsters.
newText:
If you control a "Noble Arms" Equip Spell, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). You can only Special Summon "Noble Knight Custennin" once per turn this way. A "Noble Knight" monster that was Synchro, Xyz or Link Summoned using this card on the field as material gains this effect.
●If this card is Special Summoned, you can: During your Main Phase this turn, you can Normal Summon 1 monster in addition to your Normal Summon/Set (you can only gain this effect once per turn), also, you cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck for the rest of this turn, except "Noble Knight" monsters.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Noble Knight Custennin
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect granted to a monster summoned using Noble Knight Custennin is optional to activate.

references.title: Card FAQ – Noble Knight Custennin
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect granted to a monster summoned using Noble Knight Custennin allows Normal Summoning any monster – not only a "Noble Knight" monster.
